title: Introducing Expertise Logic into Graph Representation Learning from A Causal Perspective. (arXiv:2301.08496v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Benefiting from the injection of human prior knowledge, graphs, as derived discrete data, are semantically dense so that models can efficiently learn the semantic information from such data. Accordingly, graph neural networks (GNNs) indeed achieve impressive success in various fields. Revisiting the GNN learning paradigms, we discover that the relationship between human expertise and the knowledge modeled by GNNs still confuses researchers. To this end, we introduce motivating experiments and derive an empirical observation that the GNNs gradually learn human expertise in general domains. By further observing the ramifications of introducing expertise logic into graph representation learning, we conclude that leading the GNNs to learn human expertise can improve the model performance. Hence, we propose a novel graph representation learning method to incorporate human expert knowledge into GNN models. The proposed method ensures that the GNN model can not only acquire the expertise held

translated_title: 从因果关系的角度引入专业逻辑到图形表示学习
translated_abstract: 图形数据由于注入了人类先验知识，因此语义密集，模型可以从这些数据中有效地学习语义信息。因此，图神经网络（GNN）在各个领域取得了令人瞩目的成功。然而，重新审视GNN学习范式，我们发现人类专业知识与GNN模拟的知识之间的关系仍然令人困惑。为此，我们引入了激励实验，并得出实证观察结果称GNN逐渐学习到了普通领域中的人类专业知识。通过进一步观察将专业逻辑引入到图形表示学习中的后果，我们得出结论，引导GNN模型学习人类专业知识可以提高模型性能。因此，我们提出了一种新的图形表示学习方法，将人类专业知识纳入GNN模型。所提出的方法确保GNN模型不仅可以获得专业知识，同时可以将其应用于各种不同的任务中。
tldr: 本文引入激励实验，得出GNN模型逐渐学习普通领域中人类专业知识的实证观察结果。通过将专业逻辑引入到图形表示学习中，可以提高GNN模型的性能。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces motivating experiments and concludes that graph neural networks (GNNs) gradually learn human expertise in general domains. By incorporating human expert knowledge into GNN models, performance can be improved.
